questions.text: A 60-year-old man is on bed rest since 10 days. He develops sudden onset breathlessness and chest pain. Which of the following is the best investigation?

70-year-old smoker presents with high grade fever, cough and confusion with diarrhea. CXR shows bilateral infiltrates in both lower lung fields. On sputum gram stain, no organisms were detected. Na= 126 mEq/ L, AST-62, ALT 56, RBS -112 mg/di and serum Bilirubin 0.8 mg%. Which of the following organisms is responsible?
Which of following is cause of exudative pleural effusion?
Which is correct about cryptic TB?

options.label: A
options.text: Positive skin tuberculin test and positive CR

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.text: Negative skin tuberculin test and positive CXR

questions.correct_answer: B. Negative skin tuberculin test and negative CXR

questions.text: Child has developed recurrent lung infections with thickened sputum and CXR shows bronchial wall thickening. He has been suffering from steatorrhea since birth. Which of the following is first differential diagnosis?
A 60/M presents with 18-year history of exposure to asbestos. Which of the following is most likely to develop in this patient?
HIV positive patient develops lung infection. His CD4 count is less than 100cells/ cu.mm and sputum shows acid-fast organism. Which of the following organisms is responsible?
A smoker had developed blood-tinged sputum during cough. On work up Chest X-ray was normal. Which of the following is the next procedure done?
A male smoker patient who has difficulty in swallowing is most likely to develop which of the following!
Comment on ABG report: pH = 7.28 pCO2= 80 mm Hg and HCO3=28mEq/L?
A patient presents with complaints of morning time productive cough that is yellow that increases on turning from left to right side. Which of the following lung diseases is likely to be present?
DOC for Legionnaires disease!
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • The DOC for legionella is now updated to include Levofloxacin apart from Azithromycin and either one can be used.

questions.text: The following image shows

A 60-year-old woman who is a known case of lung cancer is having shortness of breath. On examination her neck veins are engorged showing gross elevation of JVP, Heart sounds are distant and breath sounds appear reduced on left side infra-scapular area. CXR is done and is shown below. Comment on the diagnosis of the patient.
Young patient develops bout of acute dysentery. He subsequently develops bilateral ascending quadriplegia. Pain and proprioception sensation is preserved. First differential diagnosis is.
Most common cause of death in diabetic ketoacidosis is?

Child presents with fever for 11 days with neck rigidity. LP was done and shows 75% mono-nuclear cells with CSF sugar = 50 mg (Blood sugar 100 mg/dl) and protein is 3000 mg/dl. CXR of patient shows upper lobe involvement with hilar enlargement. Diagnosis is? lymph node
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • In Bacterial meningitis glucose is extremely low (CSF) 10-20

questions.text: Female presents with history of taking OCP and headache for last 6 months which worsens on recumbent position and improves as day progresses. Fundus examination shows Papilledema. There is no focal neurological deficit. MRI shows raised ICP. What is the probable cause?
Most common cause of Cushing syndrome in 68yr old male
Young patient has sudden onset of severe headache, but he has never had a headache as bad as this one. He is hypertensive but non-diabetic and has nuchal rigidity. Probable diagnosis is?
Patient with ptosis, muscle weakness which increases at the end of day which gets relieved with Neostigmine. Diagnosis is? (drooping progresses as day progresses)
Which of the following is seen in Hypoglossal nerve injury?
questions.correct_answer: B. Tongue deviation to same side

questions.text: A female patient presents with fever for past 3 days and cannot touch neck to chest. LP was done, and CSF findings are: Opening pressure= increased Appearance= White cloudy Cells= Neutrophils predominantly seen CSF Sugar = 15 mg/dl. Protein: 100mg/dL

Young male 25 years of age presents with Ptosis which is worse in the evening and shows improvement in the morning. The patient complains of exertional fatigue. Work up with ice pack test shows relief in ptosis. Diagnosis is?

Young patient developed sudden anset fever and agitated behavior for 2 days. No meningeal signs were noted. EEG shows periodic focal Temporal lobe spikes, CSF shows-40 cells with 90% lymphocytes and 10% neutrophils with normal CSF Sugar and slight elevation protein. Which of the following should be started in the patient!

A 45-year-old male with HbAIC 8% comes to ER with hemiplegia 8 hours prior to consult. NCCT head shows intracerebral bleed. BP 198/110 mm Hg. Which of the following intervention is best scheduled for this patient?

A 65-year-old male presented with weakness, lethargy, excessive cold intolerance and slow ankle jerk. On TFT. TSH-16mU/L (normal: 0.4-4.0 mU/L) and T40.3 ng/ dL (normal: 0.6-1.6 ng/dL) and T3 70 pg/dl. (normal: 230-619 pg/dl.). What would be the most appropriate management?

options.label: A
options.text: Start levothyroxine at 100 microgram and decrease the dose gradually

options.label: B
options.text: Start levothyroxine at 25 microgram and increase the dose gradually

options.label: C
options.text: Start levothyroxine at 25 microgram and decrease the dose gradually

questions.correct_answer: B. Start levothyroxine at 25 microgram and increase the dose gradually
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Since TSH is elevated and T4 and T3 are reduced it implies primary hypothyroidism. In patient with no residual thyroid function starting dose is 100-150 micrograms. However in this case since T3 and T4 are being produced starting dose would be 25 ug per day

questions.text: A patient was asked to copy the clock face made by the physician. The image on right is made by the patient. Which is correct about this image?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • In the right aungular gyrus.
  • • The Clock Drawing Testis a simple and effective cognitive test used to assess executive function and visual-spatial test lion. It is a reliable screening tool for cognitive dysfunction, particularly for dementia. Loss of visuospatial skills is called as apraxia.
  • • Major visuospatial errors seen on the CDT given in image
  • • 1. Right/Left reversal
  • • 2. Omitting one half of the clock

questions.text: A 30-year-old man presents with repeated myoclonic jerks and dementia. Which is the most probable etiology?

A 60-year-old woman presents with weakness in right arm for a duration of four hours. The weakness gradually became lesser and resolves. She is a known case of Hypertension and BMI is elevated. Which of the following is the probable diagnosis of this case?

A 30-year-old alcoholic had his last drink 48 hours ago. He develops anger and rage attacks and appears unable to identify faces of family members and can see inanimate objects. He has been brought to the ER. What is your diagnosis?
A patient presents with head, hand enlargement with gynecomastia and lactation. Where is the tumor located?
What is the likely diagnosis of this case?

A 35-year-old woman presented with complaints of palpitations and weight loss. On examination sinus tachycardia is present, and the following lesion was noticed on the shin of the patient. What is the clinical diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Ref: Harrison 20th ed. pg. 2703
  • • • The image shows pretibial myxedema which is a characteristic feature of Graves disease.
  • • • Option a is ruled out due to presence of weight loss and sympathomimetic symptoms
  • • • Option c leads to lymphedema of legs and genitals
  • • • Option d is present since birth with lymphedema.

questions.text: 20-year-old patient developed UTI infection and 10 days later presents with peri-orbital edema with RBC in urine and 800mg protein/ g of urinary creatinine. BP =140/90 mm Hg and C3 levels are reduced. Anti-DNA-ase antibody is present. Diagnosis is?
Patient presents with hemoptysis and hematuria. Anti GBM antibody is seen. Diagnosis is?
A young presents with gastric outlet obstruction and vomiting. Which of the following fluid will be used!
A Female has difficulty in standing up from squatting position, cannot comb her hair and has violaceous heliotrope rash around upper eye lid. The presentation is of which of the following conditions?
Post-menopausal woman presents with knee pain. Joint aspiration was done and shows needle shaped negatively birefringent crystals in polarized microscopy. The diagnosis is?

A 60-year-old patient presents with throbbing unilateral headache, nodular thickening along the temporal artery. Biopsy of vessels shows giant cells and granulomatous vasculitis. The likely diagnosis is?
An elderly patient presents with focal seizures. CT shows multiple ring enhancing granulomas. Which of the following is not to be given immediately in next 24 hours?
Calcitonin is a marker of which malignancy?

A 33-year-old woman is being evaluated for excessive daytime sleepiness and forgetfulness which have been present for the past 1 year. Her BMI is 43, her BP is 170/98 mmHg. In an awake state, ABG shows pOz 70 mmHg, pCO253 mmHg, HCO 33 mmol/L. What is the most likely diagnosis?

40-year lady presents with difficulty in eating due to persistent dry mouth. She also has grittiness in eyes due to dry eyes. On examination dental caries is noted with enlarged cervical lymph nodes. Possible diagnosis is?

50-year-old patient with lung cancer presents with breathlessness and light headedness. On lung auscultation reduced intensity of breath sounds are heard on the left infero-scapular region. Diagnosis is?

23-year-old patients presents with a history of flank Pain and fatigue and history of red coloured urine. On investigation there were more than 20 BC/ HPF and microscopy showed dysmorphic BC. What is the most likely diagnosis?

70-year-old man presents with low back ache and progressive pallor. On work up KFT is deranged, LFT is normal with normal level of albumin, but gamma globulins are disproportionately increased. X ray Spine shows multiple lytic lesions. Which of the following is cell of origin of the diagnosis of this patient?

Child is brought with a 2-week day history of not feeding well and excessive irritability. History of TB in sister in present. In work-up LP was performed. Which of the following is likely to be found in CSF?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Lymphocytosis, high sugar and high protein

options.label: C
options.text: Neutrophils, low sugar and low protein

options.label: D
options.text: Neutrophils, low sugar and high protein

questions.correct_answer: A. Lymphocytosis, low sugar and high protein

questions.text: 60-year-old man presents with sudden onset right sided hemiparesis for last 3 hours. BP is - 220 /130 mm Hg. NCCT head showed hyper dense lesion. All of the following are to be done for management except?

questions.text: Patient presents with headache, vomiting and nuchal rigidity. LP was done and shows turbid CSF. Microscopy shows 90% PMN cells with sugar of 40 mg/dL (RBS 120 mg/dl) and protein of 200 mg/dl. Which is correct about management of this case?
